metadata.Title: CVE-2019-19448 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
In the Linux kernel 5.0.21 and 5.3.11, mounting a crafted btrfs filesystem image, performing some operations, and then making a syncfs system call can lead to a use-after-free in try_merge_free_space in fs/btrfs/free-space-cache.c because the pointer to a left data structure can be the same as the pointer to a right data structure. It was discovered that the btrfs file system in the Linux kernel contained a use-after-free vulnerability when merging free space. An attacker could use this to construct a malicious btrfs image that, when mounted and operated on, could cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19448` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1078-aws - 4.4.0-1078.82
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1098-azure - 4.15.0-1098.109~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-190-generic - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-190-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-190-lowlatency - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-190-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-190-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-190-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-190-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-190-generic - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-190-lowlatency - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1098-azure - 4.15.0-1098.109~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-190-generic - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-190-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-190-lowlatency - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-190-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-190-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-190-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-190-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1

linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-190-lowlatency - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: tyhicks> Exploiting this vulnerability requires a crafted filesystem image to be mounted sbeattie> it's asserted that the btrfs enhanced tree-checker should address this issue; this was backported to at least the 4.15 kernels.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1078.82').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1098.109~14.04.1').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1').
linux-signed: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-signed-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1098.109~14.04.1').
linux-signed-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1').
